nodes.bodyText: I don't think this is correct. I think you need to create a buffer that is the size of file.count(), then just calling transferTo once should be enough. If you don't have enough space in the buffer then there is no way to read all the contents.

Ah yea, in that case I think it should just work without the loop. According to the docs:
Fewer than the requested number of * bytes are transferred if this channel's file contains fewer than * <tt>count</tt> bytes starting at the given <tt>position</tt>, or if the * target channel is non-blocking and it has fewer than <tt>count</tt> * bytes free in its output buffer. 
This should be a blocking channel, so as far as I can see it should always succeed in one call. The ones inside Netty itself are working with non-blocking channels.
ok, that concerns me because my test passes.
Actually no, I am completly wrong here. This should be file.transferred(), which will always be 0.
@patriot1burke sorry for the noise, I got confused between the parameters the underlying file channel takes and the FileRegion itself.
Yeah, I remember why I had it like that. Its supposed to be position, not how many.
